page.title: 02BURGHFIELD-"NUCLEAR VALLEY"
page.content: The area in which we live has been nicknamed "NUCLEAR VALLEY",because of the number of establishments in the vicinity of Reading connected with the military and with arms production,both conventional and nuclear.Very near to us are the Royal Ordnance Factory (ROF) at Burghfield,the Atomic Weapons Research Establishment (AWRE) at Ald- ermaston,which provide a major source of employment in the area;and RAF Greenham near Newbury,which has been a centre of controversy over the past few years because of the U.S.A Govern- ment's decision to station 96 Cruise missiles there.These began to arrive in 1983. The teams which man these missiles are to be housed in a large develop- ment at RAF Clayhill (formerly HMS Dauntless,a training centre for WRNS), just outside Burghfield Common.
